image.altText: A woman and a man walk through glass doors, leaving a building

props.synopsis: A mother should be held criminally responsible for the death of her 15-year-old daughter, who she allegedly subjected to physical and emotional abuse for a period of five years, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

title.children: 'Treating her as a burden': Mother stands trial over daughter's death

image.altText: A brochure reading 'algal bloom summer plan', with a picture of a beach.

props.synopsis: The full details of South Australia's algal bloom summer plan which aims to ensure South Australians can "enjoy their summer" were released yesterday. The plan includes measures to protect the state's coast while supporting businesses and communities.

title.children: Why does SA have a summer plan for the algal bloom and what's in it?

image.altText: A man with blonde hair wearing sunglasses wearing a blue singlet holds part of the singlet up to his mouth

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney-General has written to the federal government urging it to block the entry into Australia of convicted Dutch child rapist Steven van de Velde, who is seeking to compete at the upcoming Beach Volleyball World Championships.

title.children: Federal government urged to deny visa to Dutch convicted rapist and volleyballer

image.altText: A search in outback terrain.

props.synopsis: After the second day of a renewed search for Gus in South Australia's outback, police say the search has "concluded with no evidence being located" as they prepare for an early start and high temperatures on Thursday.

title.children: 'No stone unturned' as search for Gus continues in SA outback

image.altText: A green sign for Hydrogen Power SA erected on a vacant arid site in Whyalla

props.synopsis: South Australia's Office for Hydrogen Power spent more than $280 million before the state government scrapped the agency amid the failure of its Whyalla hydrogen project, an auditor-general report tabled in parliament has found.

title.children: SA government's $285m spend on hydrogen revealed

image.altText: a woman stares at the camera

props.synopsis: Parents and carers are frustrated by what they say is a lack of support when trying to report several Instagram accounts targeting children under the age of 17 over the school holidays.

title.children: Parents of children targeted by 'nasty' cyberbullying feel 'helpless'

image.altText: A few cars driving down a town street

props.synopsis: Parking on South Australia's Copper Coast is a hot-button issue with one resident saying he is "prepared to go to court" over comments made about council staff, which have been labelled "offensive" and "threatening".

title.children: Council threatens ratepayer with legal action over 'offensive' comment

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest will explore whether the 2022 death of SA Police Senior Constable Benjamin Edward Warren could have been prevented if his mental health issues had been identified.

title.children: Inquest begins into death of 'hardworking and dedicated' police officer

image.altText: A large owl with bright yellow eyes sitting in a tree

props.synopsis: Powerful owls prey on possums, and even koalas, but local bird watchers are excited by the discovery of new pairs in South Australia.

title.children: Australia's largest owl, which eats koalas and possums, captured on tape

image.altText: Ian Ferguson is wearing a blue button-up short-sleeve shirt and wide brimmed hat while learing against the front of a red truck

props.synopsis: There are no manicured greens in sight, but this golf tournament brings more than 150 players to an outback sheep station to raise funds for the Royal Flying Doctor Service.

title.children: Golfers tee off to raise funds for vital outback cause

image.altText: Tarni White of the Magpies reacts during the AFLW Round six match.

props.synopsis: Collingwood's Tarni White says it feels as though the women's competition is being used as a trial run for new rules before they are implemented into the men's league.

title.children: Frustration mounts over AFLW being used as a 'trial run' for new rules

image.altText: Signage for Santos is displayed outside the company's visitor information center in Narrabri

props.synopsis: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

title.children: How a boardroom mistake in Adelaide 15 years ago cost you a fortune

image.altText: Two hands hold a phone. The person is wearing pink and black striped fingerless gloves. The phone has a charm hanging from it.

props.synopsis: LGBTIQA+ advocates are concerned the social media ban will have a significant impact on queer youth in regional and remote areas of Australia. They say there are not enough offline, physical supports for these teens to access when the ban comes into effect.

title.children: LGBTQIA+ advocates say social media ban will 'cut off' regional queer teens

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: The clock runs out on deadline day of the AFL trade period, with Hawthorn failing to seal a deal for Zach Merrett, while the Swans hand over a raft of picks to clinch a move for Charlie Curnow.

title.children: Merrett deal spectacularly collapses on deadline day as Curnow gets to Swans

image.altText: 15-year-old Dau Akueng was one of two boys killed in a stabbing attack on 7 September, in Cobblebank, Victoria

props.synopsis: A teenager in youth custody over the murders of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek is forcibly arrested by police after he repeatedly refused to attend court.

title.children: Warrant issued as teen refuses to attend court over Cobblebank killings

image.altText: Minister for Indigenous Australians Malarndirri McCarthy stands at a lecturn during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Demands our country's full attention': Funding threat on Closing the Gap

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: Headshot of a bald man holding a large beer with his fist curled.

props.synopsis: British social media star "Big John" says he is being deported from Australia after apparently failing to comply with visa requirements.

title.children: 'Had better days': UK social media star facing deportation from Perth

image.altText: A photo of a man at a press conference. He is wearing a suit ans speaking. Behind him a blurred blue sign says POLICE.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has apologised for releasing data that overstated a drop in the number of victims of crime.

title.children: 'More work to be done': Minister apologises for crime stats bungle

image.altText: Byron Waller

props.synopsis: Queensland teenager Byron Waller spent 240 hours flying about 45,000 kilometres around the world before returning to Brisbane to make history.

title.children: Family and dog welcome 16yo pilot back to Australia after record world trip

image.altText: handcuffed man in police station

props.synopsis: Investigators are probing links between a haul of drugs seized on Tuesday and the South-East Asian gang allegedly behind a failed hit in Western Sydney last week.

title.children: Police claim drug seizure linked to failed Sydney daycare hit

image.altText: A bald man wearing sunglasses and a mask around his chin takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: A lawyer calls for Roland Griffiths to face a life sentence for the murder of his wife, who he doused in petrol and set on fire in Melbourne's north-west in 2022.

title.children: Prosecutors push for house fire murderer to be jailed for life

image.altText: A pic of a passport.

props.synopsis: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

title.children: US drops out of world's most powerful passport top 10 list for the first time

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of David Pye, showing him with a beard, bald head, ponytail and neck tattoos.

props.synopsis: The man accused of organising the assassination of former Rebels boss Nick Martin believed the bikie had also arranged to have him killed, a Perth court hears.

title.children: Coffin and clapping emojis text to assassin after bikie boss's public killing, court hears

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump made the comments in reference to Time magazine's upcoming November cover story, detailing how his administration "sealed the Gaza ceasefire deal".

title.children: Trump says glowing magazine cover of him 'may be the Worst of All Time'

image.altText: A boat approaches a southern right whale and her calf

props.synopsis: The latest close encounter with a protected whale species has renewed calls for the public to give the animals space.

title.children: Close whale and calf encounter renews calls for boats to keep back

image.altText: A woman with her hands clasped under her pregnant below sitting on a stool in the kitchen

props.synopsis: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

title.children: Australia's baby recession deepens as fertility rates hit record low

image.altText: Scattered tin sheets and building degree with flooded road

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will no longer publish a cyclone outlook for WA's north, saying it was less reliable due to a changing climate.

title.children: Weather bureau 'retires' cyclone outlook ahead of WA wet season

image.altText: boy with hat on on boat

props.synopsis: A total of six children and an adult have been charged with murder after 25-year-old Jack Westren was allegedly stabbed to death at Shellharbour.

title.children: Police charge five more children with murder over train station death

image.altText: Cathy Weeden

props.synopsis: Eighteen months after Canberran Cathy Weeden and her kids purchased a home and left temporary accommodation, she received out-of-the-blue correspondence that she owed $50,000.

title.children: 'I felt like a criminal': Inquiry into debt collection likened to Robodebt

image.altText: A happy smiling woman in her 30s with backpack a is holding a thermos mug in a lush outdoor space.

props.synopsis: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

title.children: Moving somewhere hotter or colder? This is how long it will take to adjust

image.altText: Casey-Lee Peters looks into the camera, a bandage covers a port on her chest. There are framed photos in the background.

props.synopsis: A terminal cancer patient is told her failure to declare a UTI has voided her insurance policies, leaving her struggling to pay her mortgage and care for her children in her final days.

title.children: Terminally ill mum's life insurance cancelled after failure to declare UTI

image.altText: Stephen Flelli sits at a table with a drink in his hand.

props.synopsis: After vanishing without a trace, this restaurateur reappeared a year later spruiking a shiny new investment opportunity. But there's just one problem.

title.children: Chef who vanished caught selling lettuce hundreds of kilometres away

image.altText: A smiling dark-haired woman and a man, both wearing singlets in a wooden building.

props.synopsis: The inquest into the death of Kane Minion hears that investigators feared for their safety when visiting the property where the 2022 attack occurred.

title.children: Police officer drew gun on dog that killed meter reader, inquest hears

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders mediation for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over funding he says he was offered to pay for his lawyers.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann ordered into mediation over funds for lawyers
